column4: Question: is it possible to add a shortcut key to one of the terminals in Gnome? rather than having to click the icon every second
you can go into Keyboard Shortcuts on the System/Preferences menu and set one up for a terminal .. I have mine set to F4
cause I am sick of having to click the icon every second
I have Compiz Fusion installed and I can't figure out for the life of me on how to rotate the desktop cube or get it to work
I got Desktop Wall to work

then go to the Advanced Desktop Effects Settings in System/Preferences and enable the Desktop Cube and Rotate ... you can set the scroll wheel of your mouse to activate it if you also enable Viewport Switcher
its set to Ctrl+Alt+Down and it does absolutely nothing
hard to keep up more than one person is typing to me
yes compizconfig-settings-manager is installed by the way
checking if the rotate cube plugin is installed

you need Desktop Cube, Rotate Cube and even Viewport Switcher enabled in Adavanced Desktop Settings Manager .... you ought to be able to hold the scroll wheel button down on your mouse and move the cube around
